item.title: Comment on New data on marijuana legalization by Namo
item.description:
In the 90s and early 00s, if you went out to a bar or even a late night diner, you came home smelling so strongly of cigarettes that you had to shower and immediately wash your clothes.
Then for a period of about 15 years that went away — literal breath of fresh air. Maybe a year ago I suddenly had dejavu — went to a live music show at a bar and everything smelled like smoke again, only this time it was weed, not cigarettes.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/new-data-on-marijuana-legalization.html?commentID=160795240

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/new-data-on-marijuana-legalization.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=new-data-on-marijuana-legalization

item.title: Comment on New data on marijuana legalization by Zyn Connoisseur
item.description:
I think instead of “nicotine is bad for most people”, you meant “tobacco is bad for most people”

Even if you think nicotine itself is bad (unclear at best), tobacco is undoubtedly much more harmful, so that was a strange way put it

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/new-data-on-marijuana-legalization.html?commentID=160795237
